page.title: 11HISTORY OF LITTLEMILL SCHOOL
page.content: Littlemill was originally a junior secondary with 9 classes.Various specialist teachers visited the school to teach the children subjects such as woodwork and cookery.The school was also used for performing marriages and holding dances and whist drives.We also found out that the main school building burned down in January 1955. The pupils were farmed out to local schools while Littlemill School was being rebuilt.It was November before all the classes were back in their own school.Littlemill children were again moved out of their school in 1969. Cracks due to subsidence had appeared. Since the Aberfan disaster had just occured it was thought that it would be safer for the children to be temporarily taught in Drongan primary school while the work of shoring up the school took place.
